greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of times the digit 2 appears in the decimal expansion of n^3.
comment: The cubes corresponding to the first occurrence of 1, 2, 3, ... are listed in A036529, i.e., A036529(n)^(1/3) = A048367(n) is the index of the first occurrence of n.
link: Robert Israel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
example: 28^3 = 21952 is the least cube which has a(28) = 2 digits '2'.
xref: Analog for squares: A086010 (digit 2), and A086008 - A086017 for digits 0 - 9.
results.author: _M. F. Hasler_, Feb 20 2016
